contentrichtext.text: [[File:Map.Uchihara-Town.Ibaraki.PNG|thumb|Map of Uchihara, Ibaraki]] {{nihongo|'''Uchihara'''|内原町|Uchihara-machi}} was a [[towns of Japan|town]] located in [[Higashiibaraki District, Ibaraki|Higashiibaraki District]], [[Ibaraki Prefecture|Ibaraki]], [[Japan]]. On February 1, 2005 Uchihara was merged into the expanded city of [[Mito, Ibaraki|Mito]] and no longer exists as an independent [[municipalities of Japan|municipality]]. As of 2003, the town had an estimated [[population]] of 14,848 and a [[population density|density]] of 357.35 persons per km². The total area was 41.55 km². Near Uchihara, there is perhaps the only electricity pylon in the world under whose legs a road with two lanes runs through. It is part of the powerline from Watari Substation {{coord|36|24|23|N|140|24|39|E|type:landmark_region:JP|display=inline|name=Watari Substation}} to Kashiwabara Substation {{coord|36|13|9|N|140|15|15|E|type:landmark_region:JP|display=inline|name=Kashiwabara Substation}} and situated at {{coord|36.354488|N|140.371627|E|type:landmark_region:JP|display=inline|name=Pylon 24 at Uchihara}} and 45 metres tall. ==External links== * [http://www.city.mito.lg.jp/ Official website of Mito] {{ja icon}} (some English content) * [http://www.asahi-net.or.jp/~js4m-isgi/tettou/tettou113.htm The pylon under whose legs you can drive through] [[Category:Dissolved municipalities of Ibaraki Prefecture]] {{Ibaraki-geo-stub}}
